subject: Fashion
title: Hemp the Wonder Fiber
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hemp the Wonder Fiber usable.

hook.text: Hemp produces 250% more fiber per acre than cotton and needs almost no pesticides to grow.

buildup.text: It enriches the soil, grows in nearly any climate, and matures in just 80 days.

discovery.text: Hemp fabric is naturally UV-resistant, antibacterial, and gets softer with every wash.

twist.text: So why isn't hemp everywhere? Decades of drug laws banned all cannabis farming, including industrial hemp.

climax.text: Legalization is spreading, but hemp infrastructure is decades behind cotton. Fashion is just catching up.

punchline.text: The wonder fiber was illegal. Fashion is finally catching on.

quiz.question: Why hasn't hemp replaced cotton as the dominant fabric crop despite its advantages?
options: Hemp fabric is too rough and uncomfortable for most clothing
Decades of drug laws banned cannabis farming, including industrial hemp, stunting its infrastructure
Hemp only grows in tropical climates, limiting global production
